intro: Pouteria butyrocarpa, commonly known as the Brazilian butterfruit, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a small to medium-sized tree belonging to the Sapotaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The tree produces edible fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe, with a creamy, buttery texture and a sweet, nutty flavor. Its botanical features include a smooth, greyish-brown bark and the ability to thrive in humid, tropical climates with well-drained soil.
